member.name: T:Cassowary.ClEditInfo
member.summary: ClEditInfo is privately-used class that just wraps a constraint, its positive and negative error variables, and its prior edit constant. It is used as values in ClvEditPlus, and replaces the parallel vectors of error variables and previous edit constants from the Smalltalk version of the code.

member.name: T:Cassowary.ClLinearEquation
member.summary: represents linear equation constraint

member.name: M:Cassowary.ClLinearExpression.#ctor(Cassowary.ClDouble,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{Cassowary.ClAbstractVariable,Cassowary.ClDouble})
member.summary: For use by the clone method.

member.name: M:Cassowary.ClLinearExpression.AddExpression(Cassowary.ClLinearExpression,System.Double,Cassowary.ClAbstractVariable,Cassowary.ClTableau)
member.summary: Add n*expr to this expression from another expression expr. Notify the solver if a variable is added or deleted from this expression.

member.name: M:Cassowary.ClLinearExpression.AddExpression(Cassowary.ClLinearExpression,System.Double)
member.summary: Add n*expr to this expression from another expression expr.

member.name: M:Cassowary.ClLinearExpression.AddVariable(Cassowary.ClAbstractVariable,System.Double)
member.summary: Add a term c*v to this expression. If the expression already contains a term involving v, add c to the existing coefficient. If the new coefficient is approximately 0, delete v.

member.name: M:Cassowary.ClLinearExpression.AddVariable(Cassowary.ClAbstractVariable,System.Double,Cassowary.ClAbstractVariable,Cassowary.ClTableau)
member.summary: Add a term c*v to this expression. If the expression already contains a term involving v, add c to the existing coefficient. If the new coefficient is approximately 0, delete v. Notify the solver if v appears or disappears from this expression.

member.name: M:Cassowary.ClLinearExpression.AnyPivotableVariable
member.summary: Return a pivotable variable in this expression. (It is an error if this expression is constant -- signal ExCLInternalError in that case). Return null if no pivotable variables

member.name: M:Cassowary.ClLinearExpression.SubstituteOut(Cassowary.ClAbstractVariable,Cassowary.ClLinearExpression,Cassowary.ClAbstractVariable,Cassowary.ClTableau)
member.summary: Replace var with a symbolic expression expr that is equal to it. If a variable has been added to this expression that wasn't there before, or if a variable has been dropped from this expression because it now has a coefficient of 0, inform the solver. PRECONDITIONS: var occurs with a non-zero coefficient in this expression.

member.name: M:Cassowary.ClLinearExpression.ChangeSubject(Cassowary.ClAbstractVariable,Cassowary.ClAbstractVariable)
member.summary:
This linear expression currently represents the equation oldSubject=self. Destructively modify it so that it represents the equation newSubject=self.
Precondition: newSubject currently has a nonzero coefficient in this expression.
NOTES Suppose this expression is c + a*newSubject + a1*v1 + ... + an*vn.
Then the current equation is oldSubject = c + a*newSubject + a1*v1 + ... + an*vn. The new equation will be newSubject = -c/a + oldSubject/a - (a1/a)*v1 - ... - (an/a)*vn. Note that the term involving newSubject has been dropped.

member.name: M:Cassowary.ClLinearExpression.NewSubject(Cassowary.ClAbstractVariable)
member.summary:
This linear expression currently represents the equation self=0. Destructively modify it so that subject=self represents an equivalent equation.
Precondition: subject must be one of the variables in this expression. NOTES Suppose this expression is c + a*subject + a1*v1 + ... + an*vn representing c + a*subject + a1*v1 + ... + an*vn = 0 The modified expression will be subject = -c/a - (a1/a)*v1 - ... - (an/a)*vn representing subject = -c/a - (a1/a)*v1 - ... - (an/a)*vn
Note that the term involving subject has been dropped. Returns the reciprocal, so changeSubject can use it, too

member.name: M:Cassowary.ClLinearExpression.CoefficientFor(Cassowary.ClAbstractVariable)
member.summary: Return the coefficient corresponding to variable var, i.e., the 'ci' corresponding to the 'vi' that var is: v1*c1 + v2*c2 + .. + vn*cn + c

member.name: T:Cassowary.ClLinearInequality
member.summary: Represents linear inequality constraint

member.name: M:Cassowary.CassowarySimplexSolverPointExtensions.AddPointStays(Cassowary.ClSimplexSolver,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Cassowary.ClPoint})
member.summary:
Add weak stays to the x and y parts of each point. These have increasing weights so that the solver will try to satisfy the x and y stays on the same point, rather than the x stay on one and the y stay on another.
List of points to add weak stay constraints for.

member.name: T:Cassowary.ClSimplexSolver
member.summary: Simplex solver. Resolves set of constraints using system of linear equations

member.name: M:Cassowary.ClSimplexSolver.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor initializes the fields, and creaties the objective row.

member.name: M:Cassowary.ClSimplexSolver.AddConstraint(Cassowary.ClConstraint)
member.summary:
Add a constraint to the solver.
The constraint to be added.

member.name: M:Cassowary.ClSimplexSolver.TryAddConstraint(Cassowary.ClConstraint)
member.summary:
Same as AddConstraint, throws no exceptions.
False if the constraint resulted in an unsolvable system, otherwise true.

member.name: M:Cassowary.ClSimplexSolver.AddEditVar(Cassowary.ClVariable,Cassowary.ClStrength)
member.summary: Add an edit constraint for a variable with a given strength. Variable to add an edit constraint to. Strength of the edit constraint.

member.name: M:Cassowary.ClSimplexSolver.RemoveEditVar(Cassowary.ClVariable)
member.summary: Remove the edit constraint previously added. Variable to which the edit constraint was added before.

member.name: M:Cassowary.ClSimplexSolver.BeginEdit(Cassowary.ClVariable[])
member.summary: Marks the start of an edit session.
member.remarks: BeginEdit should be called before sending Resolve() messages, after adding the appropriate edit variables.

member.name: M:Cassowary.ClSimplexSolver.Cassowary#IEditContext#EndEdit
member.summary: Marks the end of an edit session.
member.remarks: EndEdit should be called after editing has finished for now, it just removes all edit variables.

member.name: M:Cassowary.ClSimplexSolver.RemoveEditVarsTo(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Remove the last added edit vars to leave only a specific number left.
Number of edit variables to keep.

member.name: M:Cassowary.ClSimplexSolver.Cassowary#IEditContext#Resolve
member.summary: Re-solve the current collection of constraints, given the new values for the edit variables that have already been suggested (see method).

member.name: M:Cassowary.ClSimplexSolver.Cassowary#IEditContext#SuggestValue(Cassowary.ClVariable,System.Double)
member.summary: Suggest a new value for an edit variable.
member.remarks: The variable needs to be added as an edit variable and BeginEdit() needs to be called before this is called. The tableau will not be solved completely until after Resolve() has been called.

member.name: M:Cassowary.ClSimplexSolver.AddStay(Cassowary.ClVariable,Cassowary.ClStrength,System.Double)
member.summary:
Add a stay of the given strength (default to ClStrength#Weak) of a variable to the tableau..
Variable to add the stay constraint to.

member.name: M:Cassowary.ClSimplexSolver.AddStay(Cassowary.ClVariable,Cassowary.ClStrength)
member.remarks: Default to weight 1.0.

member.name: M:Cassowary.ClSimplexSolver.AddStay(Cassowary.ClVariable)
member.remarks: Default to strength ClStrength#Weak.

member.name: M:Cassowary.ClSimplexSolver.RemoveConstraint(Cassowary.ClConstraint)
member.summary: Remove a constraint from the tableau. Also remove any error variable associated with it.

member.name: P:Cassowary.ClSimplexSolver.AutoSolve
member.summary: Controls wether optimization and setting of external variables is done automatically or not.
member.remarks: By default it is done automatically and never needs to be explicitly called by client code. If is put to false, then needs to be invoked explicitly before using variables' values. (Turning off while addings lots and lots of constraints [ala the AddDel test in ClTests] saved about 20 % in runtime, from 60sec to 54sec for 900 constraints, with 126 failed adds).

member.name: M:Cassowary.ClSimplexSolver.AllVariables
member.summary: All known external variables

member.name: M:Cassowary.ClSimplexSolver.RemoveVariable(Cassowary.ClVariable)
member.summary: Removes all constraints using variable

member.name: M:Cassowary.ClSimplexSolver.AddWithArtificialVariable(Cassowary.ClLinearExpression)
member.summary: Add the constraint expr=0 to the inequality tableau using an artificial variable.
member.remarks: To do this, create an artificial variable av and add av=expr to the inequality tableau, then make av be 0 (raise an exception if we can't attain av=0).

member.name: M:Cassowary.ClSimplexSolver.TryAddingDirectly(Cassowary.ClLinearExpression)
member.summary: Try to add expr directly to the tableau without creating an artificial variable.
member.remarks: We are trying to add the constraint expr=0 to the appropriate tableau.
member.returns: True if successful and false if not.

member.name: M:Cassowary.ClSimplexSolver.ChooseSubject(Cassowary.ClLinearExpression)
member.summary: Try to choose a subject (a variable to become basic) from among the current variables in expr.
member.remarks: We are trying to add the constraint expr=0 to the tableaux. If expr constains any unrestricted variables, then we must choose an unrestricted variable as the subject. Also if the subject is new to the solver, we won't have to do any substitutions, so we prefer new variables to ones that are currently noted as parametric. If expr contains only restricted variables, if there is a restricted variable with a negative coefficient that is new to the solver we can make that the subject. Otherwise we can't find a subject, so return nil. (In this last case we have to add an artificial variable and use that variable as the subject -- this is done outside this method though.)

member.name: M:Cassowary.ClSimplexSolver.Optimize(Cassowary.ClObjectiveVariable)
member.summary: Minimize the value of the objective.
member.remarks: The tableau should already be feasible.

member.name: M:Cassowary.ClSimplexSolver.DeltaEditConstant(System.Double,Cassowary.ClAbstractVariable,Cassowary.ClAbstractVariable)
member.summary: Fix the constants in the equations representing the edit constraints.
member.remarks: Each of the non-required edits will be represented by an equation of the form: v = c + eplus - eminus where v is the variable with the edit, c is the previous edit value, and eplus and eminus are slack variables that hold the error in satisfying the edit constraint. We are about to change something, and we want to fix the constants in the equations representing the edit constraints. If one of eplus and eminus is basic, the other must occur only in the expression for that basic error variable. (They can't both be basic.) Fix the constant in this expression. Otherwise they are both non-basic. Find all of the expressions in which they occur, and fix the constants in those. See the UIST paper for details. (This comment was for ResetEditConstants(), but that is now gone since it was part of the screwey vector-based interface to resolveing. --02/16/99 gjb)

member.name: M:Cassowary.ClSimplexSolver.DualOptimize
member.summary: Re-optimize using the dual simplex algorithm.
member.remarks: We have set new values for the constants in the edit constraints.

member.name: M:Cassowary.ClSimplexSolver.Pivot(Cassowary.ClAbstractVariable,Cassowary.ClAbstractVariable)
member.summary: Do a pivot. Move entryVar into the basis and move exitVar out of the basis.
member.remarks: We could for example make entryVar a basic variable and make exitVar a parametric variable.

member.name: M:Cassowary.ClSimplexSolver.ResetStayConstants
member.summary: Fix the constants in the equations representing the stays.
member.remarks: Each of the non-required stays will be represented by an equation of the form v = c + eplus - eminus where v is the variable with the stay, c is the previous value of v, and eplus and eminus are slack variables that hold the error in satisfying the stay constraint. We are about to change something, and we want to fix the constants in the equations representing the stays. If both eplus and eminus are nonbasic they have value 0 in the current solution, meaning the previous stay was exactly satisfied. In this case nothing needs to be changed. Otherwise one of them is basic, and the other must occur only in the expression for that basic error variable. Reset the constant of this expression to 0.

member.name: M:Cassowary.ClSimplexSolver.SetExternalVariables
member.summary: Set the external variables known to this solver to their appropriate values.
member.remarks: Set each external basic variable to its value, and set each external parametric variable to 0. (It isn't clear that we will ever have external parametric variables -- every external variable should either have a stay on it, or have an equation that defines it in terms of other external variables that do have stays. For the moment I'll put this in though.) Variables that are internal to the solver don't actually store values -- their values are just implicit in the tableau -- so we don't need to set them.

member.name: M:Cassowary.ClSimplexSolver.InsertErrorVar(Cassowary.ClConstraint,Cassowary.ClAbstractVariable)
member.summary: Protected convenience function to insert an error variable into the _errorVars set, creating the mapping with Add as necessary.

member.name: F:Cassowary.ClSimplexSolver._stayMinusErrorVars
member.summary: The array of negative error vars for the stay constraints (need both positive and negative since they have only non-negative values).

member.name: F:Cassowary.ClSimplexSolver._stayPlusErrorVars
member.summary: The array of positive error vars for the stay constraints (need both positive and negative since they have only non-negative values).

member.name: F:Cassowary.ClSimplexSolver._errorVars
member.summary: Give error variables for a non-required constraints, maps to ClSlackVariable-s.
member.remarks: Map ClConstraint to Set (of ClVariable).

member.name: F:Cassowary.ClSimplexSolver._editVarMap
member.summary: Map edit variables to ClEditInfo-s.
member.remarks: ClEditInfo instances contain all the information for an edit constraints (the edit plus/minus vars, the index [for old-style resolve(ArrayList...)] interface), and the previous value. (ClEditInfo replaces the parallel vectors from the Smalltalk impl.)

member.name: P:Cassowary.ClStrength.Required
member.summary: Highest possible constraint priority
member.remarks: Solver will throw exception if cannot be satisfied

member.name: P:Cassowary.ClStrength.Strong
member.summary: Strong constraint priority

member.summary: Medium constraint priority

member.name: M:Cassowary.ClTableau.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor is protected, since this only supports an ADT for the ClSimplexSolver class.

member.name: M:Cassowary.ClTableau.NoteRemovedVariable(Cassowary.ClAbstractVariable,Cassowary.ClAbstractVariable)
member.summary: Variable v has been removed from an expression. If the expression is in a tableau the corresponding basic variable is subject (or if subject is nil then it's in the objective function). Update the column cross-indices.

member.name: M:Cassowary.ClTableau.NoteAddedVariable(Cassowary.ClAbstractVariable,Cassowary.ClAbstractVariable)
member.summary: v has been added to the linear expression for subject update column cross indices.

member.name: M:Cassowary.ClTableau.InsertColVar(Cassowary.ClAbstractVariable,Cassowary.ClAbstractVariable)
member.summary: Convenience function to insert a variable into the set of rows stored at _columns[param_var], creating a new set if needed.

member.name: M:Cassowary.ClTableau.RemoveColumn(Cassowary.ClAbstractVariable)
member.summary: Remove v from the tableau -- remove the column cross indices for v and remove v from every expression in rows in which v occurs

member.name: M:Cassowary.ClTableau.RemoveRow(Cassowary.ClAbstractVariable)
member.summary: Remove the basic variable v from the tableau row v=expr Then update column cross indices.

member.name: M:Cassowary.ClTableau.SubstituteOut(Cassowary.ClAbstractVariable,Cassowary.ClLinearExpression)
member.summary: Replace all occurrences of oldVar with expr, and update column cross indices oldVar should now be a basic variable.

member.name: P:Cassowary.ClTableau.Columns
member.summary: _columns is a mapping from variables which occur in expressions to the set of basic variables whose expressions contain them i.e., it's a mapping from variables in expressions (a column) to the set of rows that contain them.

member.name: P:Cassowary.ClTableau.Rows
member.summary: _rows maps basic variables to the expressions for that row in the tableau.

member.name: M:Cassowary.ClTableau.ColumnsHasKey(Cassowary.ClAbstractVariable)
member.summary: Return true if and only if the variable subject is in the columns keys

member.name: F:Cassowary.ClTableau.InfeasibleRows
member.summary: Collection of basic variables that have infeasible rows (used when reoptimizing).

member.name: F:Cassowary.ClTableau.ExternalRows
member.summary: Set of rows where the basic variable is external this was added to the Java/C++/C# versions to reduce time in SetExternalVariables().

member.name: F:Cassowary.ClTableau.ExternalParametricVars
member.summary: Set of external variables which are parametric this was added to the Java/C++/C# versions to reduce time in SetExternalVariables().

member.name: M:Cassowary.ClVariable.ToString

member.name: T:Cassowary.IEditContext
member.summary: Edit transaction interface

member.name: M:Cassowary.IEditContext.EndEdit
member.summary: Marks the end of an edit session.
member.remarks: EndEdit should be called after editing has finished for now, it just removes all edit variables.

member.name: M:Cassowary.IEditContext.SuggestValue(Cassowary.ClVariable,System.Double)
member.summary: Suggest a new value for an edit variable.
member.remarks: The variable needs to be added as an edit variable and BeginEdit() needs to be called before this is called. The tableau will not be solved completely until after Resolve() has been called.

member.name: M:Cassowary.IEditContext.Resolve
member.summary: Re-solve the current collection of constraints, given the new values for the edit variables that have already been suggested (see method).
